Title: Metal Mixtures and Fetal Growth
Specific Aims: Do mixtures of Pb, Cd, As, Hg, Mn predict lower birthweight better than each individual metal?
Significance: Metals are important biologically, with complex functions. Many are both nutrients and toxicants. Mixtures of metals are a real life exposure scenario. There are no published studies of metal mixtures and fetal growth. Understanding these relationships will be important to implement prevention programs.
